pageContext.claim: “I had a number. Seventy-nine percent -- it just came out. Seventy-nine percent of the Republicans think the election was a fraud. And I hear 35, 40 percent of the Democrats.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump appears to be citing a poll by Seven Letter Insight, which surveyed Trump voters; the number did not reflect all Republicans. A Reuters poll found about half of all Republicans believe President Donald Trump “rightfully won” the U.S. election but that it was stolen from him by widespread voter fraud. The poll also said 68% of Republicans said they were concerned that the election was “rigged,” while only 16% of Democrats and one-third of independents were similarly worried. We can find no evidence to support Trump's claim that as much as 40 percent of Democrats thought the election was fraudulent.
